loan.name: Kalameli
loan.use: to buy a water tank, chemicals, vegetable seeds, soil, and a rake.
loan.description:
Kalameli is a 52-year-old, married woman with four children. She runs a business of selling vegetables (cabbage and cucumbers) in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Kalameli is a Samoan citizen, and she works very hard to satisfy her customers with her fresh vegetables. Everyday, she travels to the market by bus to sell her fresh vegetables. Kalameli needs a loan to purchase more equipment (a water tank, chemicals, vegetable seeds, soil, and a rake) to help take her business to the next level.

Her dream is that one day she will earn more to buy her own vehicle to help her run the business, and send her children to school. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.
loan.whySpecial: It provides women with credit in a country where alternative financing is extremely scarce.
